commit.message:
configure.in (--enable-checking): Use a more portable `for' loop syntax.

        * configure.in (--enable-checking): Use a more portable `for'
        loop syntax.

From-SVN: r31110

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,8 @@
+1999-12-28  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
+
+	* configure.in (--enable-checking): Use a more portable `for'
+	loop syntax.
+
 1999-12-28  Kaveh R. Ghazi  <ghazi@caip.rutgers.edu>
 
 	* configure.in (AC_DECL_SYS_SIGLIST, xm-siglist.h,

@@ -789,7 +789,8 @@ no)	;;
 *)	ac_save_IFS="$IFS" IFS="$IFS,"
 	set fnord $enableval; shift
 	IFS="$ac_save_IFS"
-	for check; do
+	for check
+	do
 		case $check in
 		misc)	cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
 #define ENABLE_CHECKING 1
@@ -988,7 +989,7 @@ else { echo "configure: error: can not run $ac_config_sub" 1>&2; exit 1; }

+echo "configure:1032: checking build system type" >&5

@@ -1054,7 +1055,7 @@ test "$host_alias" != "$target_alias" &&

+echo "configure:1059: checking for $ac_word" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

@@ -1084,7 +1085,7 @@ if test -z "$CC"; then

+echo "configure:1089: checking for $ac_word" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
@@ -1135,7 +1136,7 @@ fi
       # Extract the first word of "cl", so it can be a program name with args.

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

@@ -1167,7 +1168,7 @@ fi
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:1171: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5
+echo "configure:1172: checking whether the C compiler ($CC $CFLAGS $LDFLAGS) works" >&5

 # CFLAGS is not in ac_cpp because -g, -O, etc. are not valid cpp options.
@@ -1178,12 +1179,12 @@ cross_compiling=$ac_cv_prog_cc_cross
 
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext << EOF

   if (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null; then
@@ -1209,12 +1210,12 @@ if test $ac_cv_prog_cc_works = no; then
   { echo "configure: error: installation or configuration problem: C compiler cannot create executables." 1>&2; exit 1; }

+if { ac_try='${CC-cc} -E conftest.c'; { (eval echo configure:1228: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }; } | egrep yes >/dev/null 2>&1; then

@@ -1242,7 +1243,7 @@ ac_test_CFLAGS="${CFLAGS+set}"

-echo "configure:1246: checking whether ${CC-cc} accepts -g" >&5

+#line 1287 "configure"

@@ -1292,7 +1293,7 @@ long double foo = 0.0;

+echo "configure:1387: checking for $ac_word" >&5
